SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

caao.com.xmlrpc
Class XMLRPCClient

java.lang.Object
  caao.com.xmlrpc.XMLRPCClient

public class XMLRPCClient
extends Object

XMLRPCClient allows to call remote XMLRPC method.

The following table shows how XML-RPC types are mapped to java call parameters/response values.

XML-RPC TypeCall ParametersCall Response
int, i4byte
Byte
short
Short
int
Integer		int
Integer
i8long
Long		long
Long
doublefloat
Float
double
Double		double
Double
stringStringString
booleanboolean
Boolean		boolean
Boolean
dateTime.iso8601java.util.Date
java.util.Calendar		java.util.Date
base64byte[]byte[]
arrayjava.util.List<Object>
Object[]		Object[]
structjava.util.Map<String, Object>java.util.Map<String, Object>

You can also pass as a parameter any object implementing XMLRPCSerializable interface. In this case your object overrides getSerializable() telling how to serialize to XMLRPC protocol

Version:
$Revision: 1.1 $
Author:
zafar.khaydarov

setBasicAuthentication

public void setBasicAuthentication(String username,
                                   String password)
Sets basic authentication on web request using plain credentials

Parameters:
username - The plain text username
password - The plain text password

callEx

public Object callEx(String method,
                     Object[] params)
              throws XMLRPCException
Call method with optional parameters. This is general method. If you want to call your method with 0-8 parameters, you can use more convenience call() methods

Parameters:
method - name of method to call
params - parameters to pass to method (may be null if method has no parameters)
Returns:
deserialized method return value * @throws XMLRPCException * @throws XMLRPCException * @throws XMLRPCException
Throws:
XMLRPCException
